articles.author: Nicole McCain
articles.title: 'We will not negotiate with gangsters': Western Cape top cop takes hard line after 166 murders
articles.description: Lieutenant-General Thembisile Patekile said police had no intention of sitting down with warring gangs to negotiate a ceasefire.
articles.content:
• Gang-violence led to 166 murders between April and June.
  • It also attributed to 225 attempted murders.
  • Gangsterism was behind a mass murder, in which six people were killed.
